Bronner, Dagmar (ed.): Three historical poems on Tuathal Techtmar and the bórama from the Book of Lecan. Edition, translation and commentary. Berlin: Curach Bhán Publications, 2017. 186 pp. ISBN: 978-3- 942002-32-5. € 27,50.

Cartwright, Jane (ed.): Hystoria Gweryddon yr Almaen. The Middle Welsh Life of St Ursula and the 11,000 Virgins. Cambridge: Modern Humanities Research Association, 2020. ISBN 978-1-907322-59-4 (HB, and -74-7 PB). ix + 133 p., ₤ 25 (HB) / 15 (PB).

Celtica 32 (2020). Edited by Barry J. Lewis and Ruairí Ó hUiginn. With the assistance of Christina Cleary, Andrea Palandri, Nike Stam and Daniel Watson. vi + 311 pp. ISSN 0069-1399. ISBN 978-1-85500-245-6. € 30.

Egeler, Matthias: Atlantic outlooks on being at home: Gaelic place-lore and the construction of a sense of place in medieval Iceland, Folklore Fellows’ Communications 314, Helsinki: Porvoo 2018, 324 pp., ISBN: 978-951-41-1125-9.
Egeler, Matthias: Islands in the west: Classical myth and the medieval Norse and Irish geographical imagination. Turnhout: Brepols, 2017. xii + 357 pp. ISBN 978-2-503-56938-3. € 100.

Flahive, Joseph J.: The Fenian cycle in Irish and Scots-Gaelic literature. Cork: Cork Studies in Celtic Literatures, 2017 (Cork Studies in Celtic Literatures, 1). vi + 110 p., ISBN 978-0-9955469-0-5. € 10.

Jones, Nerys Ann (ed.): Arthur in early Welsh poetry. MHRA Library of Medieval Welsh Literature. Cambridge: The Modern Humanities Research Association, 2019. xxii + 225 p. ISBN: 978-1-781889-08-4 (hardback), £ 24.99/€ 29.99; ISBN: …-09-1 (paperback), £ 12.99 / € 14.99.
